posts.text:
Good morning every one from the sunny Isle of Man
After a few phone calls to the hospital I finally got a call  from my urologist to say that the the pathology results showed my cancer to be a low grade  non-invasive type, which should have been cured by the treatment I recieved.
Now I  begin my regular 3 month check ups
This does not bother me as the important thing is to remain  strong , happy and healthy so I can spend these valuable years with my kids as they grow up.
Celebrated this morning by going out 6 km run before work
posts.topic: Waiting for full results but wont let it beat me

posts.text:
Hi All
have been trying to keep up with the site as often as possible, it's been a great support to me.
Have been away for a few weeks treating my wife to a well earned break.
Returned last week to have my first cystoscopy since diagnosis and treatment in April.
Great relief to get the all clear.
next check up in 6 months.
so getting on with living life to the full and enjoying every moment of it.
Keep up the good work on this site.

Kelvin
posts.topic: First check up since diagnosis in in April

posts.text:
Hi mike
Keep up the good work,it ain't easy ,but it will certainly be worth it.
I gave up smoking the day my first kid was born, 17 years ago.
Got pissed off at first because my weight kept going up.
But now I go out running and attend the gym with my son 3-4 times a week, in those days I had problems running to the end of the street without getting out of breath! 
good luck
Kelvin
posts.topic: Nine months since I quit smoking!
